seniority_level.evidence: Title is 'Data Engineer' without senior qualifier, intermediate Python requirement, Master's degree required but no specific years experience mentioned, suggesting mid-level role

job_family.evidence: Title explicitly states 'Data Engineer' and core responsibilities focus on building ETL/ELT pipelines, data transformation, and database operations

sub_specialty.evidence: Primary focus on ETL/ELT processes, data extraction/manipulation/transformation, and database operations. No streaming or real-time processing mentioned

leadership_expectation.evidence: Role involves collaboration and team work but no mention of mentoring, leading teams, or direct reports. Pure individual contributor focus

primary_cloud.evidence: No cloud providers mentioned. Databases listed (SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL) are traditional relational databases that could be on-premise or cloud-agnostic

secondary_clouds.evidence: No cloud providers mentioned at all, so no secondary clouds to list

processing_paradigm.evidence: Focus on ETL/ELT processes, data extraction/manipulation/production from database tables, and scheduled pipeline operations suggests batch processing

orchestrator_category.evidence: No specific orchestration tools mentioned (no Airflow, Spark, dbt, etc.). Focus is on ETL/ELT processes without specifying orchestration framework

storage_layer.evidence: Emphasis on relational databases (SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL) and data extraction/manipulation suggests traditional data warehouse approach

remote_restriction.evidence: Work model is onsite in New Jersey, suggesting candidates need to be in the same geographic region (NJ/NY area)

timezone_focus.evidence: Location in New Jersey, United States suggests Eastern Time Zone focus within Americas region

relocation_required.evidence: Onsite requirement in New Jersey implies candidates would need to relocate to the area if not already local

h1b_friendly.evidence: No visa sponsorship mentioned in job posting, and work authorization not explicitly discussed

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: No mention of student visa support, and Master's degree requirement suggests established professionals rather than students

citizenship_required.evidence: No citizenship requirements mentioned, suggesting standard work authorization in US is sufficient

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Full-time position description and traditional employee role suggests W2 employment rather than contractor arrangement

benefits_level.evidence: No benefits, equity, PTO, or other compensation details mentioned in job posting

growth_path_clarity.evidence: No career progression, advancement opportunities, or growth paths mentioned in job description

mentorship_signals.evidence: No mentorship programs, working with senior staff, or learning opportunities explicitly mentioned

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No promotion, advancement, or career progression opportunities mentioned

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: No mention of internal transfers, role changes, or mobility opportunities

career_tracks_available.evidence: No career tracks, paths to senior roles, or advancement opportunities mentioned

requirement_strictness.evidence: Clear distinction between must-have skills (Python, databases, ETL) and nice-to-have (data processing, Numpy, Pandas). Master's degree required but flexible in related fields

scope_definition.evidence: Focused job description with clear data engineering responsibilities, ETL/ELT focus, and well-defined technical requirements

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: Requirements are reasonable for mid-level data engineer role - intermediate Python, database experience, and Master's degree are appropriate expectations
